LightningComponentBundle.description: An alternative flow file upload component which maps functionally to lighting:fileUpload.

property.name: accept
property.label: Accepted Formats
property.description: Comma-separated list of file extensions that can be uploaded in the format .ext, such as .pdf, .jpg, or .png.

property.name: disabled
property.label: Disabled
property.description: Specifies whether this component should be displayed in a disabled state. Disabled components can't be clicked. The default is false.

property.name: fileFieldName
property.label: File Field Name
property.description: Name of a custom field on the ContentVersion object. Set its value with the file-field-value attribute.

property.name: fileFieldValue
property.label: File Field Value
property.description: Value to store in the custom field specified by file-field-name for the uploaded file.

property.name: label
property.label: Label
property.description: The text label for the file uploader.

property.name: multiple
property.label: Allow Multiple Files
property.description: Specifies whether a user can upload more than one file simultaneously. The default is false.

property.name: name
property.label: Name
property.description: Specifies the name of the input element.

property.name: recordId
property.label: Record Id
property.description: The record Id of the record that the uploaded file is associated to.

property.name: hoverText
property.label: Hover Text
property.description: The hover text for the file upload component.

property.name: autoNavigateToNextStep
property.label: Automatically Navigate to Next Step Upon File Upload Completion
property.description: If true, once the file upload completes, the flow will automatically navigate to the next step. The default is false.

property.name: contentDocumentIds
property.label: Content Document IDs
property.description: The IDs of the uploaded files. Store this value in a text collection variable.

property.name: fileNames
property.label: File Names
property.description: The Names of the uploaded files. Store this value in a text collection variable.
